Post.title: How to launch apps with shell command
Post._content:
# vimshell
vimvim


1.usr/local/bin/ 
sublime text
	
	sudo ln -s /Application/Sublime\ Text.app/Contents/SharedSupport/bin/subl /usr/local/bin/subl
	


	subl [filename]
	
2.aliasshellMWeb lite
~

	vim .bash_profile
	


	alias mwebl='open -a /Applications/MWeb\ Lite.app/Contents/MacOS/MWeb\ Lite'
	


	source .bash_profile
	
MWeb litemd

	mwebl ./source/_post/somepost.md
	
hexomd

3.shsh

Post.title: first post
Post._content:
# githexo
hexo-gitPagegitgithexopost
[hexo main page](https://hexo.io)
[Markdown gramma](http://www.appinn.com/markdown/#link)
[hexo](http://www.tuicool.com/articles/fiYVbaY)
[neXt](https://github.com/iissnan/hexo-theme-next/wiki)

## hexonode.js
1.node.js[node.js](https://nodejs.org/en/)pkg
2.hexo

	mkdir blog//
	cd blog
	npm install hexo --no-optional #
	npm init
	npm install
	npm install hexo-deployer-git
	
3.githubMarcteen.github.io [ssh](http://www.jianshu.com/p/a655bbc178e3)

	git clone git@github.com:Marcteen/Marcteen.github.io.git
	git branch hexo #
	git checkout hexo
	git push origin hexo #github
githubhexopush

	git config --global push.default "current"
	
4.blog

	cp ../blog/* ./
	rm -rf ../blog #mv
	
5..gitignore

	
6.hexogithubhexo
	git add .
	git commit -m 
	git push origin hexo
	
7.

	vim _config.yml
	
deploy

	type: git
  	repository: git@github.com:Marcteen/Marcteen.github.io.git
  	branch: master
	

## hexo
1.clone

git clone git@github.com:Marcteen/Marcteen.github.io

hexo[](http://ilewen.com/questions/1940)

2.hexohexo initgit

## 
1.[](http://blog.csdn.net/wizardforcel/article/details/40684575)

	hexo new title
	


* layout #postpage
* title	#	 
* date	#
* updated	#
* comments	#	
* tags	#	 
* categories	#	 
* permalink	#url
	
2.,

	git add .
	git commit -m 
	git push origin hexo
	
3.
	hexo clean
	hexo g
	hexo -d
	
## git



	git fetch origin hexo #<> <>
	


	git merge origin/hexo
	


	git rebase
	
hexogit~

Post.title: Hello World
Post._content:
Welcome to [Hexo](https://hexo.io/)! This is your very first post. Check [documentation](https://hexo.io/docs/) for more info. If you get any problems when using Hexo, you can find the answer in [troubleshooting](https://hexo.io/docs/troubleshooting.html) or you can ask me on [GitHub](https://github.com/hexojs/hexo/issues).

## Quick Start

### Create a new post

``` bash
$ hexo new "My New Post"
```

More info: [Writing](https://hexo.io/docs/writing.html)

### Run server

``` bash
$ hexo server
```

More info: [Server](https://hexo.io/docs/server.html)

### Generate static files

``` bash
$ hexo generate
```

More info: [Generating](https://hexo.io/docs/generating.html)

### Deploy to remote sites

``` bash
$ hexo deploy
```

More info: [Deployment](https://hexo.io/docs/deployment.html)

---
title: Hello World
---
Welcome to [Hexo](https://hexo.io/)! This is your very first post. Check [documentation](https://hexo.io/docs/) for more info. If you get any problems when using Hexo, you can find the answer in [troubleshooting](https://hexo.io/docs/troubleshooting.html) or you can ask me on [GitHub](https://github.com/hexojs/hexo/issues).

## Quick Start

### Create a new post

``` bash
$ hexo new "My New Post"
```

More info: [Writing](https://hexo.io/docs/writing.html)

### Run server

``` bash
$ hexo server
```

More info: [Server](https://hexo.io/docs/server.html)

### Generate static files

``` bash
$ hexo generate
```

More info: [Generating](https://hexo.io/docs/generating.html)

### Deploy to remote sites

``` bash
$ hexo deploy
```

More info: [Deployment](https://hexo.io/docs/deployment.html)
